page.title: 05MOOR HALL, NE Sutton C'field
page.content: Moor Hall Mansion is an imposing building. It is now the centre of Moor Hall Golf Club, opened in 1932, which lies in park land in the SW corner of the block. It includes a golf shop and a licensed hotel and restaurant. The eighteen hole links are most attractive. One section of trees is still known to some children as the "Haunted Wood". Membership of this club is ardently sought after by local golfers. The mansion itself was built, as his home, by Bishop Vesey who got the land from the King in 1527. Bishop Vesey then looked kindly on his old home of Sutton encouraging markets and prosperity. The octagonally shaped Tudor cottage standing near Moor Hall also dates from those times.
